ptpa-common.description: Configure basic information of adaptive clock.

enable.description: Enable/disable adaptive clock. When the master does not support PTP, the router that enables adaptive clock can retrieve clock information from the server's PTP packets.

device-type.description: Configure the router to work in client or server mode.

nego-mode.description: Enable or disable PTP adaptive ACR/ATR unicast negotiation.

dscp.description: Configure QoS priority of ptp-adaptive packet.

domain.description: Configure ptp-adaptive device domain. While profile is configured as 'Support Partly', the default domain value is 0 and domain range is <0-255>. While profile is configured as 'Partly', the default domain value is 4 and domain range is <4-43>.While profile is configured as 'Time Synchronization Protocol', the default domain value is 44 and domain range is <44-63>.

local-ip.description: Local IP address that the client uses for Layer 3 unicast negotiation.

req-ann-interval.description: Interval at which Announce packets are sent by the client to the server. The calculation formula for the interval in seconds is (2 to the power of interval/1024)s.

req-sync-interval.description: Interval at which Sync packets are sent by the client to the server. The calculation formula for the interval in seconds is (2 to the power of interval/1024)s.

req-dly-resp-interval.description: Interval at which DelayResp packets are sent by the client to the server. The calculation formula for the interval in seconds is (2 to the power of interval/1024)s.

ann-recv-timeout.description: Number of times Announce packet receiving times out on the client.

ann-duration.description: Duration for continuously sending Announce packets.

sync-duration.description: Duration in which Sync packets are continuously sent.

dly-resp-duration.description: Duration in which Delay-Resp packets are continuously sent.

trace-source.description: Current tracing source of the client.

freq-profile.description: By default, ITU-T G.8265.1 is partially supported. You can configure total support for G.8265.1 or G.8275.2.

vpn-instance.description: Configure or cancel the VPN instance name bound to the Loopback interface.

ptpa-servers.description: List of configure information about the remote server on which negotiation with the client is established.

ptpa-server.description: Configure information about the remote server on which negotiation with the client is established.

server-index.description: Index of the server, which is used to identify a server.

is-cur-trace-source.description: Current tracing source of the client.

clock-id.description: ID of the clock source on the server side.

error-reason.description: Cause of the clock negotiation failure.

bmc-attr.description: Statistics of PTP adaptive clock attributes when the PTP frequency profile is not configured.

priority1.description: Priority1 of the adaptive clock server.

priority2.description: Priority2 of the adaptive clock server.

clock-class.description: Quality level of the server clock.

time-source.description: Clock source type of the adaptive clock server.

ptp-sync-uncertain.description: Synchronization uncertain status of the adaptive clock source.

bmca-attr.description: Statistics of PTP adaptive attributes when we configure ptp frequency profile.

server-ssm.description: SSM level converted from the accuracy of clock signals received by the server.

server-priority.description: Priority of a server. Server1's priority is 1, and Server2's priority is 2.

parent-clockid.description: Clock ID of the clock server.

parent-port-num.description: Port number of the clock server.

two-step-flag.description: Two-step flag of clock source Sync packets.

steps-removed.description: Number of hops to the clock source.

time-scale.description: Time scale of the clock source.

time-traceable.description: Time tracing status at the server side.

frequency-traceable.description: Frequency tracing status at the server side.

loss-announce.description: Announce packet loss status at the server side.

loss-sync.description: Sync packet loss status at the server side.

loss-followup.description: Follow_Up packet loss status at the server side.

loss-resp.description: Resp packet loss status at the server side.

asym-correction.description: Configure information about asymmetric delay correction.

asym-corr-flag.description: Asymmetric delay correction mode, including positive correction and negative correction.

correction.description: Automatically measured asymmetric delay correction value. This is a 1588 ATR feature. When link asymmetry exists, the asymmetric delay correction value needs to be measured manually.

ptpa-clients.description: List of statistics of adaptive clock client information.

ptpa-client.description: Statistics of adaptive clock client information.

client-id.description: Index of a client, which is used to identify the client.

clockid.description: ID of the clock source on the client side.

nego-mode.description: Negotiation mode between server and client.

ann-interval.description: Interval at which the server sends Announce packets to the client.

sync-interval.description: Interval at which Sync packets are sent by the server to the client.

dly-resp-interval.description: Interval at which Delay-Resp packets are sent from the server to the client.

ann-duration.description: Duration in which the server continuously sends Announce packets to the client.

sync-duration.description: Duration in which Sync packets are continuously sent by the server to the client.

dly-resp-duration.description: Duration in which Delay-Resp packets are continuously sent by the server to the client.

client-pkt-statistics.description: Statistics of various packets sent from the server.

rev-signal.description: Statistics about the Signaling packets received by the server.

rev-delay-req.description: Statistics about the Delay_Resp packets received by the server.

send-signal.description: Statistics about the Signaling packets sent by the server.

send-announce.description: Statistics about the Announce packets sent by the server.

send-sync.description: Statistics about the Sync packets sent by the server.

send-delay-resp.description: Statistics about the Delay_Resp packets sent by the server.

discard-signal.description: Number of signaling packets dropped on the server.

discard-delay-req.description: Number of Delay_Req packets dropped on the server.

adaptive-virtual-ports.description: List of configure information about adaptive virtual ports.

adaptive-virtual-port.description: Configure information about the virtual port which in the master, slave, or passive state can be adaptively determined.

port-ip.description: Port IP address that the device uses for Layer 3 unicast negotiation.

vpn-instance.description: Configure or cancel the VPN instance name.

remote-port-ip.description: Remote IP address of the port.

clock-class.description: Quality level of the server clock.

priority2.description: Priority2 of the adaptive server clock.

server-virtual-ports.description: List of configure information about server virtual ports.

server-virtual-port.description: Configure information about the virtual port which only in the master state.

port-ip.description: Port IP address that the device uses for Layer 3 unicast negotiation.

vpn-instance.description: Configure or cancel the VPN instance name.

client-infos.description: List of configure information about clients.

client-info.description: Statistics of adaptive clock client information.

client-id.description: Index of a client, which is used to identify the client.

clock-id.description: ID of the clock source on the client side.

nego-mode.description: Negotiation mode between server and client.

ann-interval.description: Interval at which the server sends announce packets to the client.

sync-interval.description: Interval at which synchronization packets are sent by the server to the client.

dly-resp-interval.description: Interval at which delay response packets are sent from the server to the client.

ann-duration.description: Duration in which the server continuously sends announce packets to the client.

sync-duration.description: Duration in which synchronization packets are continuously sent by the server to the client.

dly-resp-duration.description: Duration in which delay response packets are continuously sent by the server to the client.
